poem:
### Sober Dream

Sunlit football,  
Beer gardens brimming,  
Negroni turned paloma  
Frosted with evening's whisper—  
Condensed moments on a digital plane.  
Yet, quiet in the circle of abstinence,  
A friend steps aside,  
Untethered from the cusp of twilight—

I see them still,  
In the space between sips,  
A sober dream unfolding.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "I am sober curious – but a little alcohol is still valuable to me | Emma Beddington The sun is out, the football is on, beer gardens are packed and sunset-pink shots of condensation-frosted palomas (the new negroni) are plastered across Instagram, but I bet someone in your life has given up drinking. Maybe more than one person. I know lots (if you count parasocial “knowing”, and I don’t get out much, so I do).". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
